title: HTML Element
description: The root element of an HTML page. It wraps all the content on the page.

title: Head Element
description: Contains meta-information about the document, such as the title and links to stylesheets.

title: Title Element
description: Defines the title of the document, which appears in the browser tab.

title: Body Element
description: Contains the content of the document, such as text, images, and links.

title: Heading 1 Element
description: Defines the most important heading. There are six levels of headings (h1 to h6).

title: Heading 2 Element
description: Defines a second-level heading.

title: Paragraph Element
description: Defines a block of text, typically used for regular content.

title: Anchor Element
description: Defines a hyperlink that links to another page or resource.

title: Image Element
description: Embeds an image in the document. It is a self-closing tag.

title: Division Element
description: Defines a division or section in the document. It is often used as a container for other elements.

title: Span Element
description: Defines a section in a document for styling purposes. It is an inline element.

title: Unordered List Element
description: Defines a list of items in no particular order. Each item is defined using the <li> tag.

title: Ordered List Element
description: Defines a list of items in a specific order. Each item is defined using the <li> tag.

title: List Item Element
description: Defines an item in a list. It can be used inside <ul> or <ol>.

title: Table Element
description: Defines a table. Tables consist of rows and columns.

title: Table Row Element
description: Defines a row in a table.

title: Table Data Element
description: Defines a cell in a table. It must be inside a <tr>.

title: Table Header Element
description: Defines a header cell in a table. It is typically bold and centered.

title: Form Element
description: Defines an HTML form for user input.

title: Input Element
description: Defines an input field where the user can enter data.

title: Button Element
description: Defines a clickable button.

title: Label Element
description: Defines a label for an <input> element.

title: Select Element
description: Defines a dropdown list.

title: Option Element
description: Defines an option in a dropdown list or <select> element.

title: Textarea Element
description: Defines a multi-line text input control.

title: Line Break Element
description: Inserts a single line break. It is a self-closing tag.

title: Horizontal Rule Element
description: Creates a thematic break or horizontal line in the document.

title: Strong Element
description: Defines important text, typically displayed as bold.

title: Emphasis Element
description: Defines emphasized text, typically displayed as italic.

title: Blockquote Element
description: Defines a section that is quoted from another source.

title: Code Element
description: Defines a fragment of computer code.

title: Preformatted Text Element
description: Defines preformatted text, which is shown in a fixed-width font.

title: SVG Element
description: Defines an SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) container.
example: <svg width='100' height='100'><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' stroke='black' stroke-width='3' fill='red' /></svg>

title: Canvas Element
description: Used to draw graphics on the fly via scripting (usually JavaScript).

title: Video Element
description: Defines a video or movie in the document.
example: <video controls><source src='movie.mp4' type='video/mp4'>Your browser does not support the video tag.</video>

title: Audio Element
description: Defines sound content in the document.
example: <audio controls><source src='audio.mp3' type='audio/mpeg'>Your browser does not support the audio tag.</audio>

title: IFrame Element
description: Defines an inline frame, which is used to embed another document within the current HTML document.

title: Link Element
description: Defines the relationship between the current document and an external resource (most used to link stylesheets).

title: Meta Element
description: Defines metadata about the HTML document. It is a self-closing tag.

title: Script Element
description: Defines a client-side script, such as JavaScript.

title: Style Element
description: Defines style information for a document. It is used for CSS.

title: NoScript Element
description: Defines an alternate content to be displayed when the script is not supported or disabled.

title: Meta Element
description: Defines metadata about the HTML document, such as character set and author.
